sentences: Meie klassis oli kaks paari kaksikuid.
context: The Estonian word 'paar' has multiple meanings. It can refer to a pair of matching items (like shoes or gloves), a couple of people working together, a married or romantic couple, or even an unspecified small quantity of things. As a noun in its singular form, it refers to one pair/couple, while in plural ('paarid') it means multiple pairs/couples.
